citation.article-title: Assignment of Actinomyces pyogenes-like (CDC coryneform group E) bacteria to the genus Actinomyces as Actinomyces radingae sp. nov. and Actinomyces turicensis sp. nov.

p.s: Descrlptlon of Actinomyces radingae sp. nov.
Actinomyces radingae (pertaining to Radinga, the Latin name for Reading, UK)
The following description is based on an examination of three strains (Wust et al. 1993).
The cells consist of straight and slightly curved rods with some branching (approximately 0.5-0.8 μm diameter x 2-3 μm); part of the cells show slight clubbing.
Most cells stain Gram-positive with some irregularities giving a beaded appearance.
Growth on sheep blood agar is equal under aerobic conditions with 5% CO2 and anaerobically.
Colonies on sheep blood agar are whitish to greyish, slightly dull, circular, low convex of about 0.3-0.5 mm diameter after 48-h incubation aerobically with 5% CO2.
Haemolysis cannot be detected in two strains and is weak in one strain; haemolysis is absent anaerobically.
Catalase-negative.
Acid is produced from glucose, glycogen, maltose, mannose, ribose, sucrose and xylose.
Triple sugar iron agar is acidified in both slant and butt.
Acid is not produced from amygdalin, rhamnose and sorbitol.
Acid production from arabinose, cellobiose, erythritol, fructose, galactose, inositol, lactose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, salicin and trehalose was variable.
C4 and C8 esterases, leucin arylamidase and pyrazinamidase are positive.
Alkaline phosphatase, trypsin, β-glucuronidase, lipase, cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, phosphohydrolase, α-mannosidase and pyrrolidonyl arylamidase are negative.
Aesculin is hydrolysed only slowly by two strains.
Urea and gelatin are not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The main metabolic fatty acids are succinic and lactic acids.

The major cellular fatty acids when grown in PRAS peptone yeast glucose medium with Tween 80 are 10:0 (approximately 4-6%), 14:0 (3-7), 16:1cis9 (8-12), 16:0 (11-13), 18:1cis9 (39-57), feature 10 (18:1C11/T9/T6 or un-17.834 equivalent chain length fatty acid) (8-12).
DNA base composition is 60 mol% G + C (Tm).
Peptidoglycan is of the L-Lys(L-Orn)-L-Lys-D-Glu tvpe (A5α).
Strains have mainly been isolated from mixed infections associated with anaerobes, Streptococcus 'milleri', enterococci, and Gram-negative rods.
The habitat is unknown.
The type strain (APLI) is DSM 9169T (=CCUG 32394T).
